==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|あい|あい|かさ|k3=がさ}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{l/ja|相合い傘}}, {{l/ja|相々傘}}, {{l/ja|相相傘}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|あいあいがさ}}

# Sharing an umbrella, especially in a romantic situation.
#: {{ja-usex|'''相合傘'''で散歩している二人が向うに見えます。|'''あいあいがさ''' で さんぽ している ふたり が むこう に みえます。|You can see a couple walking '''together under an umbrella''' over there.}}
# A slang term to indicate that two people are going out together.
#: {{ja-usex|その二人はもう'''相合傘'''だわ。|その ふたり は もう '''あいあいがさ''' だ わ。|Those two are already '''sharing an umbrella''', don't you know.}}

====Usage notes====
'''{{lang|ja|相合傘}}''' has a strong romantic implication, which stems from the fact that it is a play on words. The first two characters are pronounced {{ja-r|あい}}, which is homonymic of the word {{ja-r|愛|あい}}, which means [[love]], and thus the connotation is that both people under the umbrella are in love.

====Related terms====
* {{ja-r|相傘|あいがさ}}: variation of {{lang|ja|相合傘}}
* {{ja-r|傘|かさ}}: umbrella
* {{ja-r|愛|あい}}: love
